meanings.definition: The process of removing acid from a substance.
meanings.sent1: The deacidification of the soil improved the growth of plants.
meanings.sent2: The deacidification of the water made it safe to drink.
meanings.sent3: The deacidification of the lemon juice turned it into a sweet lemonade.
meanings.sent4: The deacidification of the vinegar transformed it into a milder condiment.
meanings.sent5: The deacidification of the paper preserved it for years to come.

meanings.definition: The act of neutralizing or reducing acidity.
meanings.sent1: Proper deacidification of the solution prevented it from corroding the metal.
meanings.sent2: The deacidification of the soil helped maintain a balanced pH level.
meanings.sent3: The deacidification of the orange juice made it less sour and more enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: The deacidification of the wine enhanced its flavor profile.
meanings.sent5: The deacidification of the stomach helped with digestion.

meanings.definition: The treatment of acidic materials to make them less acidic.
meanings.sent1: The deacidification of the fabric prevented it from losing color.
meanings.sent2: The deacidification of the food preserved it for longer storage.
meanings.sent3: The deacidification of the tomatoes made them taste less tangy.
meanings.sent4: The deacidification of the solution reduced its harmful effects.
meanings.sent5: The deacidification of the battery prolonged its lifespan.
